input_sentence: ego vehicle shall not overtake the vehicle in front until vehichle behind the ego is overtaking the ego vehicle.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front
Vehicle behind ego overtakes ego vehicle

temporal_relations.description: Ego shall not overtake front vehicle until behind vehicle overtakes ego

lexicon.ego_overtakes_front: Ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front
lexicon.behind_overtakes_ego: Vehicle behind ego overtakes ego vehicle

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_front → front_vehicle  
   - obj_behind → behind_vehicle

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object1,object2) format:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego,front_vehicle) [ego overtakes front_vehicle]
   - ap_2: overtake(behind_vehicle,ego) [behind_vehicle overtakes ego]

3. Apply temporal relation "until":
   - Antecedent: ~overtake(ego,front_vehicle) [ego shall not overtake front_vehicle]
   - Consequent: overtake(behind_vehicle,ego) [until behind_vehicle overtakes ego]
   - Temporal operator: U (until)

4. Apply global property "Always":
   - Wrap entire formula with G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G (~overtake(ego,front_vehicle) U overtake(behind_vehicle,ego))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_front → front_vehicle  
   - obj_behind → behind_vehicle

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object1,object2) format:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego,front_vehicle) [ego overtakes front_vehicle]
   - ap_2: overtake(behind_vehicle,ego) [behind_vehicle overtakes ego]

3. Apply temporal relation "until":
   - Antecedent: ~overtake(ego,front_vehicle) [ego shall not overtake front_vehicle]
   - Consequent: overtake(behind_vehicle,ego) [until behind_vehicle overtakes ego]
   - Temporal operator: U (until)

4. Apply global property "Always":
   - Wrap entire formula with G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula `G (~overtake(ego,front_vehicle) U overtake(behind_vehicle,ego))` uses the global operator `G` applied to an until structure `U` without explicit time bounds, meaning this pattern holds continuously over all time.
- The predicate `overtake(ego,front_vehicle)` translates to "ego overtakes the front vehicle" based on the variable vocabulary provided.
- The predicate `overtake(behind_vehicle,ego)` translates to "the vehicle behind overtakes ego vehicle" based on the variable vocabulary.
- The negation `~` applied to `overtake(ego,front_vehicle)` means "ego does not overtake the front vehicle".
- The until operator `U` indicates that "ego does not overtake the front vehicle" must hold continuously until the condition "the vehicle behind overtakes ego vehicle" becomes true.
- Since this is wrapped in `G`, this until relationship must hold globally (at all times).

Natural Language Translation:
Always, the ego vehicle does not overtake the front vehicle until the vehicle behind overtakes the ego vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, the ego vehicle does not overtake the front vehicle until the vehicle behind overtakes the ego vehicle.

- The predicate `overtake(behind_vehicle,ego)` translates to "the vehicle behind overtakes ego vehicle" based on the variable vocabulary.

- The until operator `U` indicates that "ego does not overtake the front vehicle" must hold continuously until the condition "the vehicle behind overtakes ego vehicle" becomes true.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components
